com.wj.android.messageviewer.gui

Class ArrowBubble

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wj.android.messageviewer.gui.ArrowBubble
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LeftArrowBubble, NoArrowBubble, RightArrowBubble

    public abstract class ArrowBubble
extends java.lang.Object
    Superclass for all bubbles that will display a message, like conversation bubbles in cartoon.
    Author:
    Werner Jaeger

      • ArrowBubble

        protected ArrowBubble(ArrowBubble.Type type,
           IMessage message,
           MessageViewer viewer)
        Creates new ArrowBubble.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to draw within the bubble.
        viewer - the viewer. Must not be null.
        type - the type of the bubble.

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        public ArrowBubble.Type getType()
        Get the type of this arrow bubble,
        Returns:
        the type. Never null:

      • setLocation

        public final void setLocation(java.awt.Point p)
        Sets the location of the ArrowBubble. Overridden to position the text box within the frame. (Calls to setLocation(int, int) forward to setLocation(java.awt.Point), so either one will work correctly.)
        Parameters:
        p - the location to set. May be null;

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(int ix,
               int iy)
        Set the location of the ArrowBubble.
        Parameters:
        ix - x coordinate of the upper-left corner of bounding box
        iy - y coordinate of the upper-left corner of bounding box

      • setSize

        public final void setSize(int iWidth,
           int iHeight)
        Set the dimension of the shape.
        Parameters:
        iWidth - the width.
        iHeight - the height.

      • setSize

        public final void setSize(java.awt.Dimension d)
        Sets the size of the ArrowBubble. NOTE: setting an explicit size for the bubble may cut off some of the text. Use setWidth(int) to specify a width for the bubble while maintaining view of all the text.
        Parameters:
        d - the dimension to set. May be null;

      • getPreferredSize

      • setWidth

        public final void setWidth(int iWidth)
        Sizes the ArrowBubble to the given width, but maintains full view of the contents by adjusting the height if necessary.
        Parameters:
        iWidth - the width to set. May be null;
